title: intel-mkl module load fails due to `unsetenv` command
body:
Summary

Loading the Spack-generated module for `intel-mkl` fails at `unsetenv PS1`

### Expected Result

Success with `module load intel-mkl/2018.0.128-gcc-7.2.0`.

### Actual Result

Module load hangs after executing `unsetenv PS1`.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Build `intel-mkl` with the compiler of choice.
2. Load Spack-generated module file

```console
$ spack install intel-mkl/2018.0.128
$ module load intel-mkl/2018.0.128-gcc-7.2.0
```


### module show
```
$ module show intel-mkl/2018.0.128-gcc-7.2.0 
-------------------------------------------------------------------
/usr/projects/draco/vendors/spack.tt.v-0.11.1/share/spack/modules/cray-CNL-haswell/intel-mkl/2018.0.128-gcc-7.2.0:

module-whatis	 Intel Math Kernel Library. 
prepend-path	 PATH /usr/.../bin 
prepend-path	 LIBRARY_PATH /usr/.../lib 
prepend-path	 LD_LIBRARY_PATH /usr/.../lib 
prepend-path	 CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH /usr/.../intel-mkl-2018.0.128-724mwpogvlmy6stlajprgc7w37lwtd5x/ 
prepend-path	 NLSPATH /usr/.../locale/%l_%t/%N 
unsetenv	 PS1 
prepend-path	 CPATH /usr/.../include 
setenv		 MKLROOT /usr/.../mkl 
prepend-path	 LD_LIBRARY_PATH /usr/.../gcc4.7 
prepend-path	 LD_LIBRARY_PATH /usr/.../intel64_lin 
prepend-path	 LD_LIBRARY_PATH /usr/.../intel64_lin 
prepend-path	 LIBRARY_PATH /usr/.../gcc4.7 
prepend-path	 LIBRARY_PATH /usr/.../intel64_lin 
prepend-path	 LIBRARY_PATH /usr/.../intel64_lin 
-------------------------------------------------------------------

```
### Trace
```
$ set -x
$ module load intel-mkl/2018.0.128-gcc-7.2.0
+ module load intel-mkl/2018.0.128-gcc-7.2.0
++ /opt/cray/pe/modules/3.2.10.6/bin/modulecmd bash load intel-mkl/2018.0.128-gcc-7.2.0
+ eval CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=/.../ ';export' 'CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH;CPATH=/...' ';export' 'CPATH;LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/...' ';export' 'LD_LIBRARY_PATH;LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/.../compilers_and_libraries_2018.0.128/linux/mkl/lib/intel64_lin:/usr/.../compilers_and_libraries_2018.0.128/linux/compiler/lib/intel64_lin:/usr/.../compilers_and_libraries_2018.0.128/linux/tbb/lib/intel64_lin/gcc4.7:/usr/.../lib:/opt/intel/2017.4.196/compilers_and_libraries_2017/linux/mkl/lib/intel64' ';export' 'LIBRARY_PATH;LOADEDMODULES=...' ';export' 'LOADEDMODULES;MKLROOT=...' ';export' 'MKLROOT;NLSPATH=/.../locale/%l_%t/%N' ';export' 'NLSPATH;PATH=/...' ';export' 'PATH;_LMFILES_=/...' ';export' '_LMFILES_;unset' 'PS1;'
++ CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=/usr/.../
++ export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH
++ CPATH=/...
++ export CPATH
++ LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/...
++ export LD_LIBRARY_PATH
++ LIBRARY_PATH=/...
++ export LIBRARY_PATH
++ LOADEDMODULES=modules/...
++ export LOADEDMODULES
++ MKLROOT=/...
++ export MKLROOT
++ NLSPATH=/.../locale/%l_%t/%N
++ export NLSPATH
++ PATH=/...
++ export PATH
++ _LMFILES_=/...
++ export _LMFILES_
++ unset PS1
++ echo -ne '\033]0;trinitite\007'
```
### Information on your system

**LANL: Trinitite**; Spack release 0.11.1; compiler: gcc@7.0; arch=cray-CNL-haswell

The location of the `unsetenv PS1` varies amongst safe versions of `intel-mkl`. Wherever encountered, it hangs Trinitite, Darwin, Snow, etc.
